item.title: Former Google trio is building an interactive AI-powered learning app for kids
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Big tech companies and upcoming startups want to use generative AI to build software and hardware for kids. A lot of those experiences are limited to text or voice, and kids might not find that captivating. Three former Google employees want to get over that hurdle with their generative AI-powered interactive app, Sparkli. Sparkli was […]

item.title: Not to be outdone by OpenAI, Apple is reportedly developing an AI wearable
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: Should this wearable materialize, it could be released as early as 2027, according to a report on the device.

item.title: Sources: Project SGLang spins out as RadixArk with $400M valuation as inference market explodes
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: SGLang, which originated as an open source research project at Ion Stoica’s UC Berkeley lab, has raised capital from Accel.

item.title: A timeline of the US semiconductor market in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: From leadership changes at legacy semiconductor companies to wishy washy policy around chip exports, a lot happened last year.

item.title: Todoist’s app now lets you add tasks to your to-do list by speaking to its AI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The feature, now public, lets you create to-do's and action items by speaking naturally to the app's AI.

item.title: Apple plans to make Siri an AI chatbot, report says
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Siri could look more like ChatGPT than its current state as an integrated feature across Apple products.

item.title: Anthropic revises Claude’s ‘Constitution,’ and hints at chatbot consciousness
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The newly revised document offers a roadmap for what Anthropic says is a safer and more helpful chatbot experience.

item.title: Irony alert: Hallucinated citations found in papers from NeurIPS, the prestigious AI conference
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Research from startup GPTZero points to the impossible problem prestigious conferences face in the age of AI slop.

item.title: YouTube will soon let creators make Shorts with their own AI likeness
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: YouTube Shorts viewers might soon see AI versions of their favorite creators when scrolling through their feeds.

item.title: OpenAI aims to ship its first device in 2026, and it could be earbuds
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The AI startup is on track to announce its first hardware device in the second half of this year, OpenAI Chief Global Affairs Officer Chris Lehane said during an interview at Davos.

item.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 tickets now on sale: Lowest rates all year
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 tickets are officially on sale. Save up to $680 on your ticket and be among the first 500 registrants to score a plus-one pass at 50% off. Don't miss 10,000 tech leaders, founders, and VCs in San Francisco from October 13-15. Register before these one-time deals vanish.

item.title: Adobe Acrobat now lets you edit files using prompts, generate podcast summaries
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Adobe is adding AI tools to Acrobat, including the ability to generate podcast summaries of files, create presentations, and a way for users to edit files using prompts.

item.title: Zanskar thinks 1 TW of geothermal power is being overlooked
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Zanskar has raised $115 million to find about a dozen geothermal resources that could help power the grid throughout the U.S. West.

item.title: Language learning marketplace Preply’s unicorn status embodies Ukrainian resilience
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Language learning marketplace Preply is now valued at $1.2 billion after raising a $150 million Series D round that marks a new chapter for the 14-year-old company.

item.title: Consumers spent more on mobile apps than games in 2025, driven by AI app adoption
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Consumers spent more money in mobile apps than games in 2025, driven by AI app adoption.

item.title: Bolna nabs $6.3M from General Catalyst for its India-focused voice orchestration platform
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Bolna said that 75% of its revenue is coming from self-serve customers.

item.title: Anthropic’s CEO stuns Davos with Nvidia criticism
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei unloaded on both the administration and U.S. chip companies over plans to sell to China. The criticism was particularly notable because one of those chipmakers, Nvidia, is a major partner and investor in Anthropic.

item.title: In an effort to protect young users, ChatGPT will now predict how old you are
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The feature is designed to stop problematic content from being delivered to users under the age of 18.

item.title: Elon Musk says Tesla’s restarted Dojo3 will be for ‘space-based AI compute’
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Tesla aims to restart work on Dojo3, its previously abandoned third-generation AI chip. Only this time, Dojo3 won’t be aimed at training self-driving models on Earth. Instead, Musk says it will be dedicated to “space-based AI compute.”

item.title: Humans&, a ‘human-centric’ AI startup founded by Anthropic, xAI, Google alums, raised $480M seed round
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Humans&, a startup that believes AI should empower people, not replace them, has reportedly raised a $480 million seed round at a $4.48 billion valuation.
